title: Electoral College Protecting the General Welfare

content.question: Respond to all parts of the question. In your response, use substantive examples where appropriate. The process of choosing a president through the electoral college is unique to the United States. Using your knowledge of election processes in the United States, develop an argument about whether the general welfare of the United States would be best protected by a president chosen by the popular vote, or a president chosen by the Electoral College. Use at least one piece of evidence from one of the following foundational documents: The Federalist 70 Brutus Article II of the United States Constitution In your essay, you must: ✓ Respond to the prompt with a defensible claim or thesis that establishes a line of reasoning. ✓ Support your claim with at least TWO pieces of specific and relevant information. One piece of evidence must come from one of the foundational documents listed above. A second piece of evidence can come from any other foundational document not used as your first piece of evidence, or it may be from your knowledge of course concepts. ✓ Use reasoning to explain why your evidence supports your claim or thesis. ✓ Respond to an opposing or alternative perspective using refutation, concession, or rebuttal.
